snippet: As some pundits were left eating crow, people who use mathematical models to make projections came out ahead.
abstract: One of biggest election battles not on any ballot was that which pitted pundits, many of whom have partisan bent and rely on subjective mixture of intuition and past experience, against pollsters, who rely on hard numbers and data; across the nation, elections results favored pollsters' numbers-based predictions.

byline.contributor: Dalia Sussman and Brian Stelter contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: As some pundits were left eating crow, people who use mathematical models to make projections came out ahead.

headline.seo: Data Devotees Emerge Victorious in Election
headline.main: Election Result Proves a Victory for Pollsters and Other Data Devotees
headline.print_headline: Election Result Proves a Victory for Pollsters and Other Data Devotees
